website_summaries.verdict: Combo string trimmer and edger powered by 5.5 amp motor to assist in your lawn care chores.
pros: Easy adjustment of pivoting head to convert from trimmer to edger with support wheel
Lightweight at 7.05 pounds, with a 15-inch cut path
cons: String control is not very good

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my 15 year old weed wacker
customer_reviews.text: I had a electric Black & Decker weed wacker I bought from Sears over 15 years ago. It was starting to show its age and decided to buy this. I am extremely pleased considering I never use a self-feeding weed wacker before. My old weed wacker I would have to manually cut and feed the line every time. It was all so much larger bulkier and heavier compared to this. What I really like about this weed wacker is it has a wheel to rest on when edging. Because of the ease of use I was able to Edge my entire yard within half the time he used to take me.
customer_reviews.author: I bought this

customer_reviews.title: Like most weed eaters, not very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I am a 66 years old retire handicap veteran. It is too heavy for me to carry around. I am going to use it as a edger, due only to the wheels holding the weight. The string breaks to easy and the auto feed does not work as advertised. I have to stop every few feet to open the unit up to restring. It took 45 minutes to edge 60 feet. If you can get the manual strip to work watch out as one side come out the other goes in and you may need to start over. Its not perfect but find me one that is.
customer_reviews.author: WEM3

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks, it doesn't work. Major line feed problems
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer started having trouble feeding line for going 6 month.Less than a year old. Went on line trying find resolution. None. Changed line type,spool, winding it tight,loose etc. No go. Takes 30 minutes to edge a 20x20 front yard.(5 minute job)Called support said change spool . I did, same trouble. No help. I'M DONE,TOTALLY FRUSTRATED. $55 piece of junk I have to take to the junk yard now. Going back to B/D again.
customer_reviews.author: Esstk

customer_reviews.title: It failed within 2 months and Greenworks does not respond
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with a mower and blower all from Greenworks. The trimmer motor failed within 2 months of normal house garden use, nothing extraordinary. I informed Greenworks through their website and included the info from the sale at Amazon and have received no response other the formal we got your email so sit tight response despite another email requesting attention. I give them some slack due to the COVID scene but still, this is not right. I cannot recommend this trimmer at all. It may have been a bad motor, who knows, but Greenworks apparently does not stand by what they sell.
customer_reviews.author: Dansker

customer_reviews.title: Great except for a fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: Powerful! Does the job! But it either eats string or jams. The automatic string feed needs some work. It did one of two things: 1 Continuously fed the line, wasting string 2 Jammed Once jammed it was extremely difficult to get it to operate for more than 2 minutes before jamming again. Threw it in the trash after a year. Looking for a trimmer with manual line feed.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Broken at the motor mount in three uses
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer didn't last long at all. I used it twice last season. This season I bring it out and the flimsy whole motor assembly breaks off and renders the unit useless. There was no way to fix or glue the motor back on, the plastic housing simply separated and broke right where you spin adjustment. Once the motor had snapped off the wires ripped right out of the motor. Three uses for this kind of money is the biggest waste I've spent on lawn care. Not to mention there is no way to easily feed the cutting line. Save your money and get a real trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B

customer_reviews.title: and it's Seahawk green!
customer_reviews.text: I really do love it. Am always looking to see what else to weed whack! Must admit my arms do get tired pretty quick but I am 61 yrs. old, 114lbs so... I also did my whole yard the first day because my lawn mower quit working. Granted my arms hurt the next day and my yard could have been a little more even but it did a good job!
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: Good luck!
customer_reviews.text: Like some others have posted... The female cord plug connected to this is crap. The conductor on mine became dislodged on the third use. It welded to my extension cord which I also tossed due to the damage. Its sad because I was so pleased with the performance until this happened. The cord on the trimmer is only 18AWG which should be sufficient for 5.5 amps, but I think the problem is how it crimped/connected inside of the molded plug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Junkie

customer_reviews.title: they don't recommend 'bumping" it om thbe ground
customer_reviews.text: well i've had it a year now . so far it works okay no maintenance issues or repairs. the only thing i'm having a problem with is the string advancement . i have to keep unscrewing the bottom part and pulling g the string out manually. they don't recommend 'bumping" it om thbe ground. it's not bad gets the job done . my personal preference is the gas powered type due to it being more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: William Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: No warranty
customer_reviews.text: Motor burns out after 20 or 30 minutes regardless of how careful you are. Warranty is useless as no one answers the phone, or any other mode of communication. It does work well for minutes it works. I went with a portland one with extra warranty at Harbor freight, all I do is bring it back to store should it fail on me. I'll never buy a greenworks product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Butch's widow

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable  and Efficient trimmer I have ever used or owned
customer_reviews.text: Great product . This item works flawlessly, it edges, trims and cuts as I hoped it would . My existing trimmer was short and forced me to hunch over to trim. This unit allow me to stand upright in a comfortable stance, really easy on my back. The line feeds smoothly and cuts everything cleanly. My current trimmer is stronger than the 5.5 amp motor, but doesn't cut as clean as the "Greenworks". I now look forward to edging and trimming since this product is so efficient and less noisy.
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: It's very heavy near the motor and very unbalanced making it annoying to hold way out at a correct angle in ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It's very heavy near the motor and very unbalanced making it annoying to hold way out at a correct angle in front you. Also even extended at max length, it's not for anyone over 5'8" tall or you'll be hunched over making this completely unergonomic! The motor and blade pivot to use like an edger but it can't make a clean line. It just chews up your grass and the motor gets hung up. I'm disappointed I wasted my money I'm just buy a regular weed wacker. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brody's Arts & Crafts LLC

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Only after the second use, it stopped working. Unfortunately it happened a day after the return grace period. I emailed the company, they replied asking me for model, and serial number, which I replied with right away. Its been more than three weeks and havent heard again from this seller. Now I'm stuck with a new, none working trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Mariosps

customer_reviews.title: Second defective one in a row.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these trimmers I've ordered, and both were defective. On the first, the rotating head to go from trimmer to edger would not stay in place. On the second, the automatic string length adjuster does not work. I had a cheaper Greenworks trimmer that worked flawlessly for years. It looks like their quality control has really gone downhill.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandor51

customer_reviews.title: My third Greenworks tool. Every other brand, rethink your strategies.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly perfect. Its smooth and powerful electric engine definitely reduced work time for me by 45 minutes compared to another prominent brand. My two laments are (1) its weight. As someone else had posted, the motor housing is on the heavy side - an inherent trade-off to either light weight or short work period ;) and (2), it's also awkward to store due to its bulkiness. A two-in-one remedy would be to include a strap that work both as a shoulder sling and a hanging aid. Missing that addition, it's still an appreciable, cost-effective tool that functions as designed.
customer_reviews.author: LeGoMac

customer_reviews.title: 5 amp motor and am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly well built for the price. As for cutting power, this thing means business. Plenty of torque on hand to get the job done. I paid a few extra dollars for the 5.5 amp motor and am glad I did. Great adjustability; the shaft telescopes in and out to fit most users and also tilts to help you access low clearance areas. This is also a useful feature when using the trimmer in weed eating mode. Only minus is the lack of a safety switch to prevent you from starting the trimmer by accidentally pressing the trigger when adjusting or connecting it.
customer_reviews.author: CarolNFam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money...I bought this unit in April 2018 before we were needing to use it. During the second use, the motor seized up and started humming. I went on Amazon to see about a replacement or refund but it was only eligible for return for 30 days. When I filled out a help request, th3 advice was to check the Manuel. Don’t buy it. It is a bad investment. A $19.99 Black and Decker from Walmart lasted for a couple years. This one less than 2 uses!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Powers

customer_reviews.title: More than you expect.
customer_reviews.text: I live up in the woods and had a yard full of weeds 2 feet tall and despite some of the reviews this thing ripped through them. Also, its pretty cool it lets out a little line every time you left off the trigger, I found my self in almost a finger dance to keep the perfect length but it was almost enjoyable cause it gives time to relax your finger a second as well. Autofeed rocks, and for the price, so does this Weed Eater.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!!!  Stay away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't order this POS. I have only used it 2 or 3 times and spend most of my time trying to get the line out of the spool. Most of the time, the line is melted together from the friction. The line that came with the trimmer mostly melted together and was unusable. I got that out of the spool and reloaded my own line. That worked a little better but still spent most of my time trying to keep the line from melting in the spool. Also, the unit is very heavy and not balanced. I strain my left bicep every single time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: the string is the downfall
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to use....until the string breaks. It's an ordeal to get it going again. The first half of my lawn is a breeze but I give up after trying to keep the string extended and then relapsing after it breaks. The trimmer is on the curb for trash pick up on Tuesday.
customer_reviews.author: Sriley721

customer_reviews.title: Line feed feature headache
customer_reviews.text: I hate the line feed feature. From day one I have had an issue with the line feed. I have never ran through so many spools before in my life. Originally I thought my issue would be getting used to dragging the cord around but the real challenge was the line feed. The line always is too short or the line melts or something on the inside & breaks off. I've had this thing for a year now & am 2 seconds away from setting it on fire! I also have the Greenworks lawnmower & I got used to dragging the cord around on that thing.
customer_reviews.author: BRAN

customer_reviews.title: Seems short and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: The thing is heavier than I expected. I am 6' tall and cannot find a comfortable way to use it. It seems that the combination of weight and length is not optimal for a somewhat tall person. I should have bought one in a local shop that I could have tried for comfort reasons. The head angle is adjustable but no matter where I set it I cannot get a feel for where the cut line is, even with the front guide attached, which is more annoying than useful. The thing has ran fine while I have had it (about a month) and has plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC value. I was looking for a 2 in ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE after 1st time use - Dec 2015 Don't know if you can beat this tool for the price. FANTASTIC value. I was looking for a 2 in 1 tool (trimmer and edger), this product does the job. If you're in the market for the same type of purchase, this is a solid choice. I bought it so I could do my own edging and trimming. Another cool thing is it saves space in my garage, don't need two tools. Will make an effort to update this review as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: agoshtas

customer_reviews.title: Could be better but I like it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great trimmer though, like others, you have to be patient with the string system. Suggest you get a better string with it or be prepared to use both that come with it on first day. It works and strong enough for most grasses. Line loader could be better but don't think it's possible at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Design is wanting
customer_reviews.text: I should not have to use an underhand grip to hold on button. Length is short If one wants a well done even lawn, aesthetically pleasing buy the push mower, electric or gas I will not return it but now not a believer in greenworks products.I needed it to get HOA off my back
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Muchiri

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for Olive Garden
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my gas weed eater took a dump; thought electric would be a change of scenery. This thing gave me problems at the very beginning. Spool didn't work; weak string (had to replenish very often); handle doesn't secure to frame very well (slowly slides to different position). Going back to gas trimmer. Seriously, SAVE your money and buy yourself and the wife the Chicken Carbonara at Olive Garden... much better value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tanja Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Broke on me, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this thing, the line they sell just broke all the time, I was reading reviews and the line for gas powered weed trimmers worked best but still not perfect. Then the thing started smoking I gave it a rest and now it just hums and won't work. It has a warrantee 3 years, I will update if the honor it.
customer_reviews.author: ScarletViolet

customer_reviews.title: Spools of line are horrible!
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer itself works well enough but the spools are incredibly tangled about half way through use. This is not user error. This is a factory defect. You don't get to use more than half the spool and then you have to throw it away and put a new one one. I wouldn't buy this trimmer or brand again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelai Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Machine works great....
customer_reviews.text: The dual line that comes with the machine leaves alittle to be desired, but if you order the 3 pack, item 28242 by Greenworks, they work pretty good and I haven't been stopped like the ones that shipped with the weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina P.

customer_reviews.title: Spending too much time fixing the string feed
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it had great reviews, and I needed to replace another string trimmer. But disappointed. 1. The latch for horizontal trimming doesn't work. It frequently tilts towards edge trimming mode. 2. It doesn't feed the strings. I spend more time fixing the string feed than actually using it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Borg

customer_reviews.title: Will get something else if this dies.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly balanced. All the weight is at the head. The line it comes with and you are supposed to use on the spools is really thin. The feeding mechanics are a poor design. The rotating head and wheel are kind of cool for edging but in the end I don't know if the are worth the extra weight in an already off balance design. Its too bad because I really like my Greenworks chain saw and my Cultivator/Tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not blown away by it, but does an adequate job.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this at Christmas along with a blower, and it arrived in a timely manner. My husband says that compared to his old trimmer that you could tap to feed string, this one seems to jam more often and eat more string. He says that all trimmers seem to do this now. Would he buy it again? He said "if you need a trimmer you need a trimmer, but I would probably jump to another brand to see if it is better." He did say that he likes the flip up feature which allows you to edge. He said he would give this trimmer 3 1/2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor string line spoiling and advancing.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and well balanced but not worth owning because of having to hand wind the line on the spool. 2 different lines, one for each side of the spool. The trimmer should come with a single spool that you fill through the side without having to remove it to get both lines wound. Also, the lines tend to jam when trying to advance them. This typically requires taking the spool off to correct the problem. I would not buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical at first. But I seriously love this thing only annoying thing is that to get more string out you have to turn it upside down push a button and manually pull it out. A little inconvenient, but not so bad compared to other "bop" models where you can accidentally use a whole spool of string if you aren't careful. this is definitely a keeper in my book and a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Os

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased locally for the same price and never got the same quality. Hands down best value for the money worked like a champ on long grass. attachments are durable and useful. Came with replacement parts easy to follow directions.
customer_reviews.author: BuyerZero

customer_reviews.title: Made for Men
customer_reviews.text: I bought this weed eater for around the house use only. The weight of the weed eater can be heavy for some people who may have a big yard or a lot high grass. There are many different ways you can use this weed eater which may cause the bottom base to be on the heavy side. I gave it 4 stars only because its heavy to be a corded weed eater. This weed eater is fast and easy to switch from job to another. Still working great and when it stop working I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Goes through line very fast. The auto feed sucks Donkey Dicks. And if you decided to rotate the head to do edging, you had better wear a face shield (Not just eye protection!). It will throw everything at your face. I have had chunks of skin carved out of my melon. Price was right...silly me.
customer_reviews.author: Beater

customer_reviews.title: Solid edger, better than the gas version
customer_reviews.text: Replaced - gas powered edger. Why? Didn’t use the gas powered version often enough and it ceased up after only a couple of seasons. Apart from the cable restriction, works fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ohanlon

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Good product just little heavy But machine work great I am very happy whit this green machine I recommend too buy this green machine
customer_reviews.author: Eden

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I trim the edges of tall grass approximately every other time (i.e. every 2nd time) that I mow the lawn. I have experience with gas trimmers and mowers, and this works just fine for trimming around our small house.
customer_reviews.author: Devon V

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Advise Purchasing.  Not Worth the Headache Using
customer_reviews.text: Don't Buy. Awful time feeding the string. Keeps breaking the string when using and you have to open up the spool and get more string loose and re thread. Was hoping for a better result. Sometimes the auto feed works and other times the string jams in the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: POS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This weedwacker is an absolute POS!!! DO NOT buy it!!! It worked great until I had to replace the first spool of string. Replacing it was easy. The hard part was keeping the line from wrapping around the piece that's supposed to let the line out gradually. The line became so tangled that the motor actually started smoking. I read a review that was very similar to mine. I thought, "I've never heard of that happening." To whomever wrote that, my deepest apologies. You were right!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: String Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and lightweight; however, I never had one and it took me about an hour to figure out that the top piece swivels into place so it can be used. Maybe directions for beginners would be a bit more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far it's working good, the line that comes with it is pretty cheap so once you change it it works much better. It is heavier than I thought compared to the black and decker I replaced. But overall it's a good little machine
customer_reviews.author: darla

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and versatile. Love the handle and control. If you don't clean the bottom or the side, then it's very hard to change the direction of the head. Great for trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Paramo

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: spend your money on something else..used it 5 minutes..now i cant get the strings out or anything..waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Dcorderoreyes

customer_reviews.title: Best weed eater I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to purchase it just because of a low price but wow! This weed wacker is one of the best I've ever owned. Very powerful motor and with the dual twine literally cuts through weeds like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Overall great value
customer_reviews.text: Overall great bang for your buck. I bought it to use on my front and back yard and it works great. I have had it for two weeks and have no issues. It gets the job done, good for basic yard work. The only thing I will say is when you use an extension cord, it tends to fall out so make sure to hold it firmly while operating
customer_reviews.author: Travis Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy. Shuts Down.
customer_reviews.text: Yep. Should have listened to the reviews when they all said this thing wasn't worth buying. It shut down after the first use. Ugh. Thankfully, Amazon refunded the money. But I'll be spending more on getting a better one this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Jeni

customer_reviews.title: Heavy to hold on hill side.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, I was surprised how well built and tough it is. Got it out of the box and used it for 2 hours on my yard which is to steep to mow with any mower, I would buy another if this ever goes bad. I love not having to listen to a gas weed trimmer for two hours after mowing all day.
customer_reviews.author: stevehumphrey

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't matter how nice the trimmer-edger is if it doesn't properly feed line
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't matter how nice the trimmer-edger is if it doesn't properly feed line. I had issues with the auto-feed right out of the box. Mine is going back. If anyone else is returning their's and can't figure out how to unassemble it - there is a tiny hole on the back of the shaft where the two meet. Just use an small allen wrench and push it in to unlock shaft assembly.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: GreenWorks Line Spool Constantly Tangles - Don't Buy It
customer_reviews.text: The GreenWorks 21272 with "dual line" feed seems quite poorly engineered. The unit itself has plenty of power and works well, but the line in the "dual spool" constantly jams. We've tried rewinding it, new line, and used different spools, followed GW's video tutorial. Regardless, it always jams within minutes. When contacted, Greenworks offers no solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Got this Greenworks 15 inch trimmer in May, all done with gardening now at the end of October, and happy to report it worked like a charm. No problems. And the edge trimmer is fantastic. Happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Bill

customer_reviews.title: Through your battery ones away
customer_reviews.text: The power this one has blows the battery ones away I just used it and it works great the auto feed works good you have to use the trigger to feed the line not hit it on the ground like most of them and with the batteries only lasting (2) years and the price for them this would pay for it self in two years I had a battery one and I am glad the battery died and the price they wanted just for the battery was all most what I paid for the unit the only problem with this is you have to use an extension cord
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T.

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty darn good, so far.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast, for a cheap electric trimmer. Swapped the line out for a heavier gauge .085 twisted line and it still auto feeds correctly and seems to handle it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Faster Tomorrow

customer_reviews.title: Great new design!
customer_reviews.text: I love this new design but found it a bit heavy compared to the old one which overheated and stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: RajahRule

customer_reviews.title: Actually works, but the auto feed and included line ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually works, but the auto feed and included line are awful. I've gone through both spools in just a handful of uses and then have to clean up all the broken line out of the grass. Someone else posted a photo of a way to use different line, so I'm going to try that before I put this in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kailyn Dykhouse

customer_reviews.title: It's a bad day to be a weed
customer_reviews.text: It's a bad day to be a weed. Maybe I've lived a sheltered life up until this point, but this is the most powerful weed whip I've ever used. My back yard is a mess because I'm more of a "sitting inside all day" kind of guy, but with this baby I made pretty short work of the mess outside. Pro tip: pair this with ground clear to make sure nothing ever grows again!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Line trimmer, it works great is easy to set up and adjust. Adding new line is quick and simple, pivots and changes easilly.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Bean

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: (disclaimer) This is my first trimmer... I love it! It's easy to use, it's feels pretty lightweight (and I'm a woman), and I love being able to use the wheels on its side to edge the grass(my edging is always perfectly straight and I'm not having to carry the weight of it- I just push it in a straight line - easy peazy). Haven't had any issues with feeding the line either :)
customer_reviews.author: Wendy F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer! I haven’t had any issue with the line feeding. I have a very large peninsula lot, and only have to change the spool every 4th trim, which is much better than prior experiences with other trimmers.
customer_reviews.author: SAHM

customer_reviews.title: The spoil constantly gets tangled
customer_reviews.text: Horrible don't waste your money. I've used it 3 times and each time I have to replace the spool. Wish there was a return option since this is not right
customer_reviews.author: dcastigl

customer_reviews.title: Only used once but I love it based on that
customer_reviews.text: Only used once but I love it based on that. Very pleasantly surprised at how good the edging function works. The hassle of dragging around an electrical cord is well worth it for the value of this trimmer over the battery powered ones in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Miller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and annoying
customer_reviews.text: Never ending struggle with string. 90% of the time is spent trying to keep the line advancing, the remaining 10% trimming Replaced out of frustration after a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Auto feed is faulty
customer_reviews.text: Auto feed is faulty. Had to buy a different one. It came pre-strung so its not the way I strung it. It ends up over feeding the line. And chewing it up, leaving little pieces all over the lawn. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Item ok
customer_reviews.text: It works good. The only bad thing is my husband is having a hard time rethreading the string. So unfortunately we are unable to use it until he figures it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jill crane

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: Although a bit heavier than comparable units this edger/trimmer works remarkably well without the terrible glitches in the Black and Decker comparable unit. You will definitely get what you paid for with this piece of yard equipment. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Webber

customer_reviews.title: most powerful plug in trimmer i've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: the versatility and extras this trimmer has is amazing. for the price, it can not be beat. at 5.5 amps, the power is amazing. it will cut through anything I could throw at it. the dual cord outlets at the spindle really provide an excellent cutting element. the ability to manipulate from trimmer to edger with just a spring-actuated button is amazing. the push button tilt allows multiple uses around any obstacle or fence line. I would highly recommend this trimmer over most any other brand out there.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Replacement product
customer_reviews.text: Replacing the old Greenworks weeder I'd had for years. It finally died
customer_reviews.author: Joyce E. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Exceeds expectations. Very pleased with first use. I like the auto feed, over old bump feed. Quick learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer G.

customer_reviews.title: Have to rethread over and over
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk have to keep re-threading string over and over and over and will not cut down anything much more than very small weeds and grass
customer_reviews.author: Rod O.

customer_reviews.title: Listen to me... don’t but this
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this trimmer for 3 times this summer. And I’ve having line feeding issue for all three times... it’s either the line feed too fast, or stuck and the line wont feed... very inconsistent... if you want your shin full if cut from lines breaking off, then you can buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Shih Yu Liu

customer_reviews.title: Not a light weight
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, heavy. All up front in the motor. Cuts good.
customer_reviews.author: philip hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used a gas edger for years. The hardest part for me was keeping my finger on the trigger so that I wouldn't waste any string. As long as you don't use the trigger like you might for a gas trimmer you won't waste your line. I have had it for almost a year and it works great every time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Crocker

customer_reviews.title: versatile
customer_reviews.text: It is a little heavy, but I am building my muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Echavarria

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy but easy to use. Was easy to assemble. Cut the grass in a small yard. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse H

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but not a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: The line kept fusing to itself. I was forced to stop every 5-7 minutes to take apart the spool compartment and unstick the fused line. I was able to work, but it took me four times as long. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Cord doesn't feed.
customer_reviews.text: I discovered, after buying several Greenworks products that this is the worst. I have to stop every 3 feet to manually pull cord. There isn't even anything in the manual to correct. The mower is great, blower, OK but underpowered. Just be hesitant at buying a weed whacker/edger.
customer_reviews.author: Will Cameron

customer_reviews.title: VROOM
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product, I'm a short woman and love that this is adjustable and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Renae Saftler

customer_reviews.title: Slowest delivery ever
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine, but it took over 1 1/2 months to arrive. Doesn't come with instructions, so it was hard to figure out the tilting head
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had a screw missing !
customer_reviews.text: nothing fir, type was so small to read and a very important screw was missing. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: john w lee

customer_reviews.title: What a little champ
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this little weed whacker. I'm a little on the lazy side, so I do not walkthrough the property and pick up branches, and this weed wacker had no trouble whacking through And over branches and rocks. Easily one of the best tools I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bad designed product. Line feed does not work very good, unit is not balanced well. It is very heavy for its size.
customer_reviews.author: Big O

customer_reviews.title: self feeding string nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: self feeding string is a bust...nothing but trouble..going to mrecycle bin...garbage..don't waste your money..i did!
customer_reviews.author: azslim

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. No line trimmer is perfect, but for my use, this one is great.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Webster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all jobs
customer_reviews.text: Love it you can do it all with this unit..
customer_reviews.author: Joezy

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: If you have issues with your back stay away from this weedwacker. It is heavy because the weight distribution is at the base . I did not care for this and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: good power -
customer_reviews.text: did not like the articulating head lock - that didn't stay locked -installed a screw between the head & main body to keep it from swiveling
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is serious! I love it! By the time I am done the front and back yards, it does feel a little heavy but it is manageable. It is a great set up with the guards and the ability to tilt the head. It does a great job edging. I havent had to replace the cord yet- I hope that it is an easy process.
customer_reviews.author: degirl

customer_reviews.title: difficulty
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to use, difficult to add a new string spool to weed eater
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Grrrrrr......
customer_reviews.text: I love my GreenWorks lawn mower, so I hoped this trimmer would be as good. Build wise, it is made extremely well made. Unfortunately, like most string trimmers, the string jammed and wouldn't budge. Getting the cover off wasn't too easy either. But then , it jammed again. I knew before my neighbors saw me in hysterics, Id better return it and retain my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Steinman

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great
customer_reviews.text: Could be Great trimmer except for line feed as it never seems to feed and always gets jammed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not a professional model.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for an electric trimmer, has plenty of power for most uses. The lock that keeps it in place for normal cutting angle broke after a half dozen uses and it had to be duct taped in place. We don't use it as an edger so it is not a deal killer for us. Cutting line is easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: W. Prentice

customer_reviews.title: BAD TRIMMER . DON'T BUY . ANY THING MADE FROM CHINA JUST FOR LOOK
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE USED IT FOR 10 MINUTES THEN MOTOR GET BURNED AND DEAD . ANU THING MADE FROM CHINA JUST FOR LOOK . DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.author: Hung Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Will break
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 3 uses and after that it started loosing power and smoke. after 5 or 6 uses it died and would not start. a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kody M. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to assemble. Handles adjust for length, and hand placement to save your back. Cuts through weeds like a breeze. Much tougher, and a better price point than previous name brand trimmer. Hopefully we will get many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: BG78th

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: There is no throttle control, and the auto-feeder barely works. You get what you pay
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple Value...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's so practical, simple, efficient and well designed that IF I needed a gas powered trimmer I would just take this and a small generator or IF I needed a battery powered trimmer I would take this, a car battery and a power inverter. My old gas trimmer is going to charity tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Gnomie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to put together and light to handle
customer_reviews.author: Raytrail August

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Trimmer - Feels Super Cheap - Does NOT Autofeed ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Trimmer - Feels Super Cheap - Does NOT Autofeed Trim Line - Was A PITA - Go Cordless - Save Yourself TIME
customer_reviews.author: Muzza

product_meta.title: Greenworks 15-Inch 5.5 Amp Corded String Trimmer 21272
product_meta.description: Style:Corded| Size:15-InchGreen Works 5.5 Amp Corded 15-inch Cutting Width, Auto Feed 0.065" single line Electric String Trimmer, Model No.21272.
feature_bullets: Lightweight, easy to use design, only 7.05 pounds
15 inch cut path with pivoting head allows for edging and trimming capability with edging wheel
0.065 dual line auto feed with electric start gets you going within seconds, no gas hassle
Ideal for small to medium size yards

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
